page.title: 10CONSERVATION AND PLANNING
page.content: The nucleus of Houston village was designated a{CONSERVATION AREA in 1968. This has helped to preserve and improve the picturesque quality of the villagescape. This is achieved by detailed planning applications.Design is tasteful and attempts to blend old and new by using suitable materials and scale,e.g.North Street features a recent gap site addition which has a traditional pen leading to an inner courtyard with a continuity of street frontage. Older buildings change their use,e.g.the old school is to become a library and museum. Outwith the old village ,developments must accord with Green Belt limits. Existing trees are protected and non-residential use is opposed to retain amenity.
